meanings.definition: The action of leading a group of people or an organization.
meanings.sent1: Her leadership during the project ensured everyone stayed on track.
meanings.sent2: In the company, the CEO's leadership is crucial for success.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed great leadership by leading the other animals in a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: His leadership shone like a beacon in the dark times of the company.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's leadership was like a warm hug, guiding students to their full potential.

meanings.definition: The state or position of being a leader.
meanings.sent1: She was proud to take on the leadership of the team.
meanings.sent2: His leadership was recognized by all as fair and just.
meanings.sent3: The leadership of the group was passed down from generation to generation.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the tallest tree held the leadership among all others.
meanings.sent5: The leadership of the captain kept the ship steady through the storm.

meanings.definition: The ability to lead or guide others.
meanings.sent1: His natural leadership made him the perfect candidate for the role.
meanings.sent2: The training program focused on developing students' leadership skills.
meanings.sent3: The duckling showed surprising leadership in leading the other animals to safety.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership was like a compass, always pointing the team in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The leadership of the coach inspired the team to victory.
